security: It becomes clear from the review of files on these defs. that debriefing of defectors, was in fact somewhat of a random nature.
summary: This document summarizes CIA files requested and screened by HSCA staff members regarding defectors, including their contact with the Agency, debriefings, and information obtained, focusing on individuals like Hair, Rice, Webster, and potentially Oswald. It also discusses the HSCA's request for materials related to the Minsk Radio Plant and the CIA's inability to locate certain files.
summary_one_paragraph: This report summarizes CIA files reviewed by HSCA staff concerning defectors, including discussions of Hair's contact with the Agency, returning Hindus (Rice), Agency contact with remaining widows (Webster), and the debriefing of defectors. It highlights an instance where a former Marine, possibly Oswald, who worked at the Minsk Radio Plant following his defection to the USSR was interviewed, and the HSCA's unsuccessful attempt to locate the associated contact report. The document also notes that debriefing of defectors seemed somewhat random and provides information on the debriefings of R.E. Webster and Kikes Quartelli, as well as index cards and other related materials.
title: CIA Files on Persons Requested and Screened by HSCA Staff
